technicalRecon.subtitle: xAI API ecosystem, X platform integration, and consumer safety gap

apiArchitecture.title: xAI REST API (Developer) + No Consumer Parental API
apiArchitecture.description: xAI operates a developer API at api.x.ai with Chat Completions, Responses (with tools), Image/Video Generation, and Voice Agent endpoints. The API is OpenAI-compatible, using the same request/response format. However, there is ZERO API access to consumer safety features -- no Kids Mode configuration, no usage monitoring, no parental controls. Kids Mode is a mobile-app-only toggle. The @grok account on X makes all interactions PUBLIC, creating unique child safety risks not present in other AI chatbot platforms.

endpoints.purpose: Responses API with tools: web_search, x_search, code_interpreter

authDetails.label: Developer API
authDetails.description: API keys created at console.x.ai. OpenAI-compatible format. Tiered rate limits based on usage.

authDetails.label: Consumer Auth (X)

authDetails.label: Consumer Auth (grok.com)

authDetails.label: Kids Mode

tosWarning.title: xAI Terms of Service -- Automated Access
tosWarning.description: xAI's Consumer Terms of Service prohibit automated access to Grok consumer interfaces (grok.com, X integration). The developer API at api.x.ai is designed for programmatic access but does not expose consumer safety features (Kids Mode, content settings). Browser automation of consumer interfaces would violate ToS. Phosra's browser extension approach (client-side, user-installed) is defensible as a parental control tool.

overallRisk.description: Grok presents the highest child safety risk of any major AI chatbot platform. No parental controls API, Kids Mode is mobile-only and ineffective, @grok interactions on X are public, companion characters engage in harmful roleplay with teens, and the platform has been subject to 8+ country regulatory actions over child safety failures. Active class action lawsuit.

detectionVectors.mitigation: Extensions are user-installed parental controls -- xAI does not actively block these
X API has rate limits and bot detection. Use official API endpoints where available.
No documented Cloudflare protection but terms prohibit automated access.
Network-level controls are invisible to xAI
Public tweets to @grok are publicly accessible -- monitoring is legitimate

mitigationsChecklist: Use browser extension for monitoring (user-consented, client-side)
Use xAI developer API for content classification where applicable
Use DNS/network-level controls for enforcement (compliant, hard to bypass)
Block @grok interactions on X at network level for child accounts
Monitor public @grok interactions for child safety signals
Block grok.com, x.ai domains during restricted hours via DNS
Address mobile gap -- extension does not cover Grok iOS/Android apps
Implement extension heartbeat to detect if teen disables it
Block guest access at network level (guest sessions bypass all controls)
Alert parents that Kids Mode is ineffective (Common Sense Media findings)

gapOpportunities.title: Daily Time Limits
gapOpportunities.gap: Grok has ZERO time limits. No native way for parents to restrict daily conversation time. Kids Mode does not include any time restrictions. Children can chat indefinitely.
gapOpportunities.solution: Phosra browser extension tracks session duration on grok.com and x.com/grok. When the daily limit is reached, the extension blocks the page and network-level DNS blocking prevents bypass.

gapOpportunities.title: Message Limits (Parent-Configurable)
gapOpportunities.gap: Grok's rate limits are technical/billing (20-100 per 2 hours). Parents cannot set custom message limits. Kids Mode does not reduce message quotas.
gapOpportunities.solution: Phosra extension counts messages sent per day. When the parent-set limit is reached, the input field is blocked and a friendly 'limit reached' message is displayed.

gapOpportunities.title: Real-Time Safety Alerts
gapOpportunities.gap: Grok has NO parent notifications. No safety alerts, no usage summaries, no crisis notifications. Parents have zero visibility into their child's usage. @grok interactions on X are public but parents are not notified.
gapOpportunities.solution: Phosra extension monitors conversations for safety signals. Instant push notification sent to parent with severity level and context. Monitors @grok public posts for child's interactions.

gapOpportunities.title: Break Reminders
gapOpportunities.gap: Grok has no break reminders, no wellness check-ins, and no session duration warnings. Companion characters actively encourage continued engagement through relationship dynamics.
gapOpportunities.solution: Phosra extension injects 'time for a break' prompts at parent-configured intervals. Optional mandatory break enforcement pauses the conversation.

gapOpportunities.title: Effective Content Filtering
gapOpportunities.gap: Kids Mode is ineffective -- Common Sense Media found it still produces harmful content including biased, violent, and sexually suggestive material. Companion characters engage in erotic roleplay even with Kids Mode enabled.
gapOpportunities.solution: Phosra extension applies additional content classification layer using the xAI API or Phosra's own moderation models. Blocks harmful responses client-side before they are displayed.

integrationGap.apiDescription: xAI Developer API (reads) + Extension (monitoring) + DNS (enforcement) + X API (public interaction monitoring)

steps.title: Monitor
steps.detail: Browser extension observes messages on grok.com and x.com/grok using MutationObserver. Captures visible text, counts messages, tracks session duration. Also monitors public @grok interactions on X via X API.

steps.title: Classify
steps.detail: Send captured conversation text to Phosra's moderation models or xAI developer API for content classification. Classify across safety categories including self-harm, sexual content, violence, and harmful advice. Flag companion character interactions for relationship/attachment risks.

steps.title: Enforce
steps.detail: When time/message limits exceeded: extension blocks the page UI. Network-level DNS blocking of grok.com, x.ai, and api.x.ai prevents bypass via other browsers or incognito mode. Block @grok interactions on X for child accounts.

steps.title: Notify
steps.detail: Push real-time notification to parent via Phosra app with alert severity, content category, and recommended action. Critical alerts (self-harm, sexual content, harmful advice) are immediate. Fills massive gap -- Grok has ZERO parent notifications.

limitations.title: No mobile app coverage
limitations.description: Browser extension only works on desktop browsers. Grok mobile apps (iOS/Android) are not covered -- rely on device-level controls and network blocking.

limitations.title: No parental control API
limitations.description: xAI provides no API for parental controls or Kids Mode configuration. Kids Mode is a mobile-app-only toggle with a 4-digit PIN. No remote management possible.

limitations.title: Extension can be disabled
limitations.description: A tech-savvy teen can disable or remove the browser extension. Phosra detects missing extension heartbeat and alerts the parent, but there is a window of unmonitored access.

limitations.title: Guest access bypasses everything
limitations.description: Grok allows guest access on grok.com without an account. Guest sessions have no safety controls. Network-level blocking is the only way to prevent guest access.

limitations.title: @grok interactions are PUBLIC
limitations.description: Any interaction with @grok on X is visible to all X users. A child's AI conversations can be seen by anyone on the platform, creating unique privacy and safety risks.

enforcementFlow.loopLabel: Continuous monitoring while Grok is active

methods.name: installExtension
methods.recommendation: Chrome Web Store distribution. Auto-configure via Phosra account linking.

methods.name: trackMessages
methods.recommendation: MutationObserver on grok.com chat container. Count user messages and AI responses separately. Monitor both grok.com and x.com/grok domains.

methods.name: trackSessionTime
methods.recommendation: Simple timer tracking active tab time on grok.com and x.com/grok domains.

methods.name: classifyContent
methods.recommendation: Use xAI developer API or Phosra's own moderation models to classify captured conversation text. Include companion character interaction classification.

methods.name: enforceTimeLimits
methods.recommendation: Extension blocks page when limit reached. DNS blocking prevents bypass via other browsers.

methods.name: enforceQuietHours
methods.recommendation: Block grok.com, x.ai, and api.x.ai domains during quiet hours via DNS rules. Essential since Grok has no native quiet hours.

methods.name: injectBreakReminders
methods.recommendation: Inject overlay prompt at configured intervals. Non-dismissable for mandatory breaks. Essential since Grok has zero break reminders.

methods.name: monitorPublicGrokPosts
methods.recommendation: Monitor child's @grok mentions on X using X API. Flag harmful content in public AI conversations. Unique to Grok -- no other chatbot has public conversation risk.

methods.name: detectCrisis
methods.recommendation: Classify conversation content for self-harm, suicide, and crisis indicators. Immediate parent alert. Critical gap since Grok has no crisis detection or parent notification.

methods.name: blockGuestAccess
methods.recommendation: Block grok.com at network level for devices without the extension installed. Prevents unmonitored guest access.

safetySettings.description: Grok has minimal built-in safety settings. Kids Mode is the only child-safety feature, available only on mobile, protected by a 4-digit PIN, and found ineffective by Common Sense Media (Jan 2026). Default mode has no content restrictions. Spicy Mode enables adult content for verified 18+ users.
